abstract: Sprint Nextel’s path to recovery has been complicated by Dish Network. | Google is close to a deal to acquire Waze. | Experts were trying to explain the steep sell-off in bonds in recent weeks. | A new Securities and Exchange Commission official may have to navigate possible conflicts.
snippet: Sprint Nextel’s path to recovery has been complicated by Dish Network. | Google is close to a deal to acquire Waze. | Experts were trying to explain the steep sell-off in bonds in recent weeks. | A new Securities and Exchange Commission official m...
lead_paragraph: Sprint Nextel’s path to recovery once seemed clear, involving a sale to SoftBank of Japan and a deal to buy full control of the wireless network operator Clearwire. But that plan has been complicated by Dish Network, which has bid for Sprint itself and Clearwire, leaving both Sprint and SoftBank to weigh backup plans, DealBook’s Michael J. de la Merced reports.

headline.main: Weighing Alternatives to a Telecom Deal
